alert.note: Alert for Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 6:22PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Pike County through 645 PM EDT... At 622 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Coleman, or 11 miles south of Williamson, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Phelps and Board Tree around 625 PM EDT. Coleman, Jamboree, Majestic and Biggs around 630 PM EDT. Fedscreek and Mouthcard around 635 PM EDT. Argo, Woodman and Toonerville around 640 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Paw Paw. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
